Hi Enrico. Nice to meet you. Also, thanks for taking time chat. Much appreciated. 

I’m currently working at an architectural company in central London as a visualisation artist in the Lighting team. And have been doing so for the last 7 years. I studied computer visualisation and animation at Ravenbourne and graduated in 2010. I’ve always been looking move into the entertainment industry ever since. 

The team I currently work with need visualisation support for client presentations etc. But its always abit as and when. Ive been developing my portfolio over the last 4 years or so to focus more on concept art and attempting to expand into 3d more to avoid narrowing my job options. 

I noticed you’re an environment artist! Is that mainly 3d work or 2d? Most of my work focuses around environment design as its the area I enjoy developing the most. 

Sam

Hi Sam! nice to meet you, my name is Enrico and I’m a Concept Artist/ Visual Development Artist from Italy. I’ve recently finished to work on a 2D tv serie at Blue Zoo in London as Environment Designer (basically I draw all the locations and some props). I mostly focus on 2D design but during the production of the show I was provided with 3D models from Sketchup to speedup the production. I’m also pushing my skills on ZBrush, so I can block basic shapes for my environment and have different angles for the same location.
That’s cool, what software you usually work with?

Sounds like we have a very similar workflow. I often use SketchUp to block out geometry and lighting and then use photoshop. I’ve been using Octane for rendering recently and trying to learn Blender. I’m looking to progress with a career in Concept Art but its difficult finding a path. How long have you been a concept artist for?

I started working in animation 4 years ago, I went from Concept Artist in Italy to Background Design when I was working in Dublin. ( here I was in the production for Transformers Rescue Bots, delivering around five BGs a day but wasn’t very creative)
Then Environment Designer for Blue Zoo where I was developing the locations for a Nickelodeon TV show called ‘It’s Pony’.
The quality of this latest show was quite high considering was 2D stuff

It takes time to get a job as Concept Artist and surely there’s not much opportunities out there but it’s good to keep practicing and don’t give up. Also it depends what kind of Concept Artist you want to be
more realistic for games or cartoony?
